DataElement.preferredName: Person Specimen Malignant Neoplasm Research Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the patient's consent regarding a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Specimen Malignant Neoplasm Research Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the consent or permission from a person to use a portion of blood, tissue, or other substance from the body in cancer research, the systematic investigation of the nature of diseases in which abnormal cells divide without control.

Property.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: My specimens may be kept for
ReferenceDocuments.description: My specimens may be kept for use in research to learn about, prevent, treat, or cure cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient's Initial Consent given for specimen kept for future use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his or her specimens to be used for research to learn about, prevent or treat cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to keep sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did this patient provide written consent to give tissue specimen(s) for research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his or her tissue to be used for research to learn about, prevent or treat cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to keep tissue sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: May your coded samples and related coded information be kept for use in research to learn about, prevent, find or treat cancer?  This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his or her tissue to be kept for use in research to learn about, prevent, treat or cure cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for her tissue to be kept for use in research to learn about, prevent, treat, or cure cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her tissue samples for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient/parent/guardian agree to have patients' specimen banked for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text14
ReferenceDocuments.description: My coded samples and related coded information may be kept for use in research to learn about, prevent, find or treat cancer.  This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: My coded samples and related coded information may be used to learn about, prevent, find or treat my type of cancer. This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text15
ReferenceDocuments.description: My specimens may be kept for future unknown use in research to learn about, prevent, treat, or cure cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission for NCCTG/Alliance to store and use his/her sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission for Alliance to store and use his/her tissue sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission for Alliance/NCCTG to store and use his/her blood and tissue sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: 9177 Inclusion Criteria
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to Tissue Procuement for cancer research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use tissue sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her tissue sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text19
ReferenceDocuments.description: My tumor tissue may be kept for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to have blood sample(s) collected on both Cycle 1 Day 2 and after completion of chemotherapy for research purposes.  The patient's coded samples and related coded information may be used to learn about, prevent, find or treat the patient's type of cancer.  This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Previously collected specimens can be used for other research studies about cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his specimens to be used for research to learn about, prevent or treat cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his specimens to be used for medical research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to have blood collected after surgery during follow-up period of study.  The patient's coded sample(s) and related coded information may be used to learn about, prevent, find or treat the patient's type of cancer.  This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to have additional blood collected after surgery during follow-up period of study.  The patient's coded sample(s) and related coded information may be used to learn about, prevent, find or treat the patient's type of cancer.  This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was consent given for patient's tissue and/or blood samples to be kept (banked) for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?
